website_summaries.verdict: Ariat was able to please hikers in terms of comfort and waterproofing with the Skyline Mid GTX. Its lightness and ankle support were also generally well-received by outdoor lovers. However, the boot’s lack of breathability was a turn-off, especially for trips set in warm environments. As a whole, the Ariat Skyline Mid GTX is still a pair of hiking boots that offers a set of positive qualities for every adventure.
pros: Droves of Ariat Skyline Mid GTX owners were able to have a comfortable experience in these hikers
The majority were pleased with the lightness of this footgear
This mid-cut hiking boot was successful in keeping water out, based on a good number of user reviews
A handful of outdoor enthusiasts lauded its ankle support
Most online purchasers reported that the Skyline Mid GTX runs true to size
This boot didn’t need a lot of time to be broken in, according to several customers
cons: A few adventurers said that the Ariat Skyline Mid GTX wasn’t breathable, causing sweaty feet in the process
Something about the cut in the latest build of this footwear didn’t sit well with a couple of wearers

customer_reviews.title: Very uncomfortable
customer_reviews.text: These boots look and feel very high quality. However the absolute killer is there is a seam that presses against the front of the ankle which is really painful. I've worn these on two hikes and a week at work, but it still bothers (it has gotten a little better). I'll update the review if it becomes acceptable. However there are good quality boots which are super comfortable and cheaper than these, so I unfortunately cannot recommend them. But they look so good, I want to like them!
customer_reviews.author: M. Pise

customer_reviews.title: Manufactured Too Narrow
customer_reviews.text: These shoes were purchased to replace an identical pair that I have worn out. The shoe is made too short and much too narrow although the label printed in the shoe indicates my correct size, 11 D. I was very pleased with my first pair of Ariat shoes but these have caused me to seek another brand.
customer_reviews.author: Tom

customer_reviews.title: Runs very small and narrow, even EE width. Order 2 sizes up.
customer_reviews.text: Tried 2 different sizes and widths and they are still too tight, especially narrow... even the EE width. And I am not normally a wide foot fit. Loved the look and build quality, but ultimately bought another brand after trying 2 sizes. Would have maybe went up another size but the pricing varied wildly and that size was more than I would want to spend. Order 2 sizes and you should be ok.
customer_reviews.author: Mark G.

customer_reviews.title: Size UP! Composite Toe Kick not full protection
customer_reviews.text: Ordered my usual size 10M, fit was too narrow across ball and arch even with thin socks. Size up at least 1/2 size, maybe a full size to accommodate multiple layers or thicker hiking socks. Otherwise feels like could be comfortable, though heel felt more hard-soled work boot than hiking boot. "Composite Toe" was nothing more than a toe shield against accidentally kicking rocks with absolutely no protection for the top of toes.
customer_reviews.author: ShyFlyGuy

customer_reviews.title: definitely cut differently
customer_reviews.text: Ariat must have changed the cut of their shoes, as these do not fit at all like my others [which are a little different style]. Would have sent them back but they were bought some time ago and given to me as a gift. Assume too much time has elapsed to return them. I am very disappointed!!!
customer_reviews.author: HasPlenty

customer_reviews.title: I loved the look of the boot and it fit as ...
customer_reviews.text: I loved the look of the boot and it fit as it was supposed to, there was just some weird stitching where the tongue met the side of the boot that rubbed against my ankle bone and I did not think it was going to be very comfortable so I had to send them back.
customer_reviews.author: Timm

customer_reviews.title: Very disappointing...
customer_reviews.text: Reduced quality. Just like any number of other boots. No heel to speak of. Lining has excess material at inside near top that folds over and cuts into your ankle. Lowest bidder design and manufacturer. USED to be great boots.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Great boots. Very comfortable
customer_reviews.text: Great boots. Very comfortable. They didn't need a break in period at all. Took them out of the box and wore them for three days straight. Only got more comfortable the longer I had them on. I wore them to a camp out and it rained the whole weekend. My feet stayed nice and dry the whole time.
customer_reviews.author: Chris M.

customer_reviews.title: Nive boots
customer_reviews.text: Real nice boot, have worn many pairs of Ariat and they are true to size and you get a lot of service out of a pair, these are no exception
customer_reviews.author: Mike C

customer_reviews.title: Most Uncomfortable Boots I Have Ever Owned
customer_reviews.text: I bought these boots to wear on a trip to Scotland, but noticed right away that, although the fit was perfect, the design is flawed. There are pressure points right around my ankle bones, caused by the way the tongue is attached to the body of the boot. I never did wear them on my trip, but recently began wearing them to work during the day, hoping they would maybe "wear in". No such luck. It became painful to wear them, and I actually have blisters near my ankle bones, especially on both inside ankles. Waste of $160!
customer_reviews.author: Jim Wills

customer_reviews.title: Comfotable, good tread, crappy leather and weak rubber foam
customer_reviews.text: Great water proof but the leather dries out super quick and the rubber foam tears off really easy. I got it fixed with epoxy and siliconed the leather, issue fixed.
customer_reviews.author: If can can

customer_reviews.title: Quality control issue
customer_reviews.text: I've been wearing Ariat boots for 10+ years. This is my first pair of shoes from them. I love these things, great styling. The reason for 1star is: on the left shoe, one of the inner seams is to high. It causes pressure and rubs badly on my ankle. After only 1 min. Of wear it made a mark, a days work would surely be very painful. I'm sure it's just a quality control issue.
customer_reviews.author: timoteo hernandez

customer_reviews.title: Love Ariats
customer_reviews.text: Only reason I've given a four star review is because I haven't had them long. Ariat boots are the only thing that helped my feet from hurting while standing or taking long hikes. I decided to try these hiking boots because of that. Great boots so far, they look and feel good. Great ankle support and completely waterproof.
customer_reviews.author: Chad Balonick

customer_reviews.title: Great boots
customer_reviews.text: The boots are being used for work boots they last longer than any of the ones we have tried
customer_reviews.author: susie foreman

customer_reviews.title: Very comfortable. Fit is true to size
customer_reviews.text: Very comfortable hiking shoe/boot. Laces are easy to tie and do not loosen. These boots required no break-in period and the fit is true to size.
customer_reviews.author: J. Caffarella

customer_reviews.title: Good looking Ariat boots
customer_reviews.text: Good looking boots and very comfortable. They are solid manufactured and fit true to size. These boots seem to be „indestructible“. I would recommend them absolutely.
customer_reviews.author: HEMI392

customer_reviews.title: Fit issues
customer_reviews.text: Boot hurt my ankle on both feet, caused by poor stitching and placement of anchors into boot on outer ankle bone. Left is worse than the right, unwearable.........too bad, it is a really nice structured boot.
customer_reviews.author: kent price

customer_reviews.title: Not good
customer_reviews.text: Hi I've received boots . They were to small. Sent them back but still have not received refund for product. Not good enough . Waiting 3 weeks for refund
customer_reviews.author: A

customer_reviews.title: One Star
customer_reviews.text: Bad quality I have 1 month of use not buy Walmart have better shoes
customer_reviews.author: Mhlh

customer_reviews.title: Waterproof hiking boots
customer_reviews.text: Great hiking boots. I like the quick tie hooks on top of boots.
customer_reviews.author: William Bower

customer_reviews.title: GREAT BUY!
customer_reviews.text: Looks good feels great!. Definetly worth every penny, great investment so far.
customer_reviews.author: Abdiel Anglero

customer_reviews.title: Good support and light weight
customer_reviews.text: Hit the trail hard and no issues. No blisters, no problem. Good support and light weight. i love them. Gave up on timberland boots
customer_reviews.author: Rick Beauchamp

customer_reviews.title: Very comfortable, light
customer_reviews.text: Very comfortable, light, fits well and a good looking boot. It's still early, but would definitely buy again based on what I've experienced so far.
customer_reviews.author: David Staples

customer_reviews.title: Most Comfortable Hiking Boots ever
customer_reviews.text: My Husband says they are the most comfortable hiking boots he's ever owned
customer_reviews.author: H

customer_reviews.title: Excellent shoes, and it's light
customer_reviews.text: Excellent shoes, and it's light. I wish they made a wide width version. Returned mine because it's a bit tight.
customer_reviews.author: Yobcibmuag

customer_reviews.title: Great looking boots
customer_reviews.text: They're beautiful boots but the 2E width wasn't wide enough for my husband's foot.
customer_reviews.author: Rhonda Underwood

product_meta.title: ARIAT Men's Skyline Mid GTX Hiking Boot
product_meta.description: Engineered for outdoor performance, Ariat skyline is constructed for durability, comfort and protection
feature_bullets: ATS Technology provides all day stability and comfort
Dual-density Duratread outsole with multi-directional traction
Premium GORE-TEX waterproof breathable membrane construction
